name: Assign
documentation: With this you can create a new Variable, or replace an existing Variable. Note that only top-level Variables can be created/replaced (i.e. you can't create/replace some_hash.subvar, but some_hash).

name: Attempt, recover
documentation: These directives are used if you want the page successfully outputted even if the outputting of a certain part of the page fails. If an error occurs during the execution of the attempt block, then the output of the attempt block is rolled back (and the error is logged, with the default configuration at least), and the recover block is executed instead, then template execution continues normally after the recover block. If no error occurs during the execution of the attempt block, then the recover block is ignored.
example:
<#attempt>
  Optional content.
<#recover>
  Ops! The optional content is not available.
</#attempt>

name: Function, return
documentation: Creates a method Variable (in the current namespace, if you know namespace feature). Return directive must have a parameter that specifies the return value of the method, and that attempts to write to the output will be ignored. If the is reached (i.e. there was no return returnValue), then the return value of the method is an undefined Variable.
parameters:
• name: name of method Variable (not expression).
  • param1, param2, ...etc.: the name of the local Variables store the parameter values (not expression);
  • returnValue: the expression that calculates the value of the method call.

name: If, else, elseif
documentation: You can use if, elseif and else directives to conditionally skip a section of the template. The condition-s must evaluate to a boolean value, or else an error will abort template processing. The elseif-s and else-s must occur inside if(that is, between the if start-tag and end-tag). The if can contain any number of elseif-s (including 0) and at the end optionally one else.
parameters: • condition, condition2, ...etc.:Expression evaluates to a boolean value.
example:
<#if x == 1>
  x is 1
<#else>
  x is not 1
</#if>
